job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Our R&D team develops microbial production strains and engineer enzymes for applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more. We implement all steps in the process, from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.

   We are looking for an experienced engineer at the interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology. As part of our team, you will create software that automates everything that can be automated and ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.

   In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side. Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.

   As Life Science Software Engineer, you will help to create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters. You have freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.

   The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement., * Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
     * Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
     * Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
     * Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
     * Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.
job_details.full_text:
Life Science Software Engineer

Our R&D team develops microbial production strains and engineer enzymes for applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more. We implement all steps in the process, from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.

   We are looking for an experienced engineer at the interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology. As part of our team, you will create software that automates everything that can be automated and ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.

   In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side. Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.

   As Life Science Software Engineer, you will help to create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters. You have freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.

   The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement., * Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
     * Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
     * Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
     * Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
     * Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.

analysis.rationale: The role emphasizes building software to automate lab processes, manage data, and integrate with ML Ops, aligning with the core responsibilities of an ML Engineer. While generative AI is mentioned, the primary focus is on data engineering, modeling, and productionizing systems for biological applications rather than developing generative AI applications themselves.

phrases.text: from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.
phrases.justification: This phrase describes the end-to-end process from initial business concept to final manufacturing, indicating an understanding of the broader business context and how technical solutions fit within it.

phrases.text: Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.
phrases.justification: This highlights the focus on delivering value and impact on products, which is a key aspect of aligning technical work with business goals.

phrases.text: Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
phrases.justification: This shows an understanding of strategic decision-making regarding technology adoption to maximize focus on core business value.

phrases.text: ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.
phrases.justification: This directly relates to making data usable and organized, a core component of data engineering.

phrases.text: Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
phrases.justification: This involves creating data structures (data models) and software to manage and process experimental data, which are fundamental data engineering tasks.

phrases.text: seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling)
phrases.justification: Integrating with systems like LIMS is crucial for data flow and accessibility, a common data engineering responsibility.

phrases.text: machine learning staff
phrases.justification: The mention of 'machine learning staff' implies that modeling activities are part of the team's work, even if not explicitly detailed for this role.

phrases.text: use of generative AI
phrases.justification: This indicates the application of generative AI techniques, which falls under the broader umbrella of modeling.

phrases.text: analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
phrases.justification: Analysis of data, especially biological data, often involves statistical modeling and interpretation.

phrases.text: interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology.
phrases.justification: This explicitly states software development as a core area of the role.

phrases.text: create software that automates everything that can be automated
phrases.justification: This is a direct software development task focused on automation.

phrases.text: create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters.
phrases.justification: This describes building software components, defining logic, and managing integrations, which are typical software development responsibilities.

phrases.text: freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.
phrases.justification: This indicates a significant role in software architecture and technology selection.

phrases.text: write software that automates the generation of robot instructions
phrases.justification: This is a specific software development task for controlling hardware.

phrases.text: Improvements are deployed with minimal delay
phrases.justification: This suggests a focus on efficient deployment and iteration, a key aspect of MLOps.

phrases.text: Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
phrases.justification: This explicitly mentions integrating with ML Ops, indicating its importance in the role's responsibilities.

phrases.text: In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side.
phrases.justification: Working alongside diverse technical and scientific roles implies a need for strong collaboration and communication.

phrases.text: Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.
phrases.justification: This directly points to communication and knowledge sharing as essential skills.

phrases.text: Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
phrases.justification: The need to adapt to evolving experimental techniques highlights the importance of continuous learning and adaptability.

phrases.text: The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement.
phrases.justification: A start-up mentality and focus on continuous improvement inherently require learning and adapting to new methods and technologies.

phrases.text: create software that automates everything that can be automated
phrases.justification: This implies identifying opportunities for automation and solving the technical challenges involved.

phrases.text: freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.
phrases.justification: This requires analytical skills to evaluate technologies and make pragmatic decisions about development versus integration.

phrases.text: Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.
phrases.justification: This suggests a proactive approach to driving improvements and taking ownership of their impact.

phrases.text: The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement.
phrases.justification: A start-up mentality often involves taking initiative and ownership of projects and outcomes.
